title: Vietnamese drug ring leader undergoes cosmetic surgery to evade capture
summary: Vietnamese drug ring leader Le Thanh Quan, arrested after plastic surgery to evade capture, was caught in Ho Chi Minh City.
location: Vietnam, Ho Chi Minh City, Dong Thap Province, Mekong Delta

title: AI startups mint new billionaires at record pace
summary: AI startups are creating billionaires faster than any tech boom, with 498 unicorns valued at $2.7 trillion. This surge is unprecedented, potentially leading to the world's first trillionaire.

title: BUV students impress employers with standout portfolios at Career Day
summary: BUV's Career Day SoCCI 2025 impressed employers with students' creative portfolios and professional skills. The event connected students with industry leaders, offering career insights and potential job offers.

title: Scale AI’s Lucy Guo, world's youngest self-made woman billionaire, says working 9 am to 9 pm is 'still work-life balance'
summary: Lucy Guo, Scale AI founder, views 9 am-9 pm workdays as work-life balance, emphasizing long hours for tech startups. She believes founders must sacrifice time for success. #WorkLifeBalance #TechStartup #LucyGuo #ScaleAI #Billionaire

title: Factors driving digital transformation at British University Vietnam
summary: BUV leads digital transformation in higher education by integrating VR, AI, and cloud systems. This enhances personalized learning and student services, aligning with global tech trends.

title: Vietnam's 80th National Day exhibition showcases achievements in technology, culture, and defense
summary: Vietnam's 80th National Day exhibition showcases national achievements in technology, culture, and defense. It features diverse zones, new technologies like VR, and special events including AI forums and film screenings.

title: Typhoon Kajiki grounds, reroutes 65 flights on August 25
summary: Typhoon Kajiki caused flight cancellations and rerouting in central Vietnam on August 25. Airports experienced disruptions, but no casualties or major damage were reported.
location: Central Vietnam, Dong Hoi Airport, Quang Tri Province, Tho Xuan Airport, Thanh Hoa Province, Vinh Airport, Nghe An Province, Phu Bai Airport, Hue city

title: Workers in Singapore more optimistic about AI than peers in US, UK
summary: Singapore professionals are more optimistic about AI's impact on work than those in the US, UK, and Australia, due to strong government support and personal upskilling efforts.
location: Singapore, US, UK, Australia, India, United Arab Emirates

title: Vietnam auto association warns proposed fuel standard could phase out 96% of cars by 2030
summary: Vietnam's auto association warns a proposed fuel standard could phase out 96% of cars by 2030. They suggest a less strict target for industry feasibility.

title: Warbirds old and new soar above Hanoi in stunning National Day parade rehearsal
summary: Vietnam's National Day parade rehearsal featured a stunning aerial display over Hanoi with vintage and modern aircraft. Su-30MK2s and Yak-130s performed complex maneuvers. Helicopters carried national flags.
location: Hanoi, Ba Dinh Square, Hoa Lac Airport, Kep Airport

title: Vietnam to host 2025 e-commerce and digital technology application forum in HCMC
summary: HCMC to host Vietnam E-commerce and Digital Technology Application Forum on Sept. 5. It aims to boost Vietnamese firms' exports and competitiveness with insights on trends and AI.
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, U.S., China, France, Singapore, Malaysia

title: Samsung SEAO President: Vietnam is a hub of innovation
summary: Samsung, Vietnam's largest foreign investor, sees the country as a hub for AI innovation and talent. Vietnam's dynamic youth and tech capabilities are key to Samsung's regional strategy.

title: Over 7,000 people trapped as floods hit central Vietnam after Typhoon Kajiki
summary: Typhoon Kajiki's remnants caused severe flooding in central Vietnam, trapping over 7,000 people in Thanh Hoa Province. Residents are being evacuated as rivers surge, submerging neighborhoods.

title: Hanoi adjusts road closure plan for National Day parade rehearsal on Wednesday
summary: Hanoi announces extensive road closures for the 80th National Day parade rehearsal on Wednesday. Authorities advise limiting travel and using public transport.

title: HCMC eyes 10% GDP growth in H2
summary: Ho Chi Minh City aims for 8.5%+ GDP growth in 2025, targeting 10.3% in H2. Plans include boosting investment, retail sales, and exports. Tourism goals are set at 8.5-10 million international visitors.

title: VinFast’s first armored limousine for top leaders withstands 440 bullets in security test
summary: VinFast's new electric limousine, the Lac Hong 900 LX, successfully passed a security test, withstanding 440 bullets and 11 grenades. It is designed for VIP leaders and features enhanced armor.

title: Typhoon Kajiki kills 3, damages 6,800 homes, cuts power to 1.6 million
summary: Typhoon Kajiki caused significant damage in Vietnam, resulting in three deaths and widespread destruction of homes and crops. The storm also led to power outages for over 1.6 million people and disrupted transportation.
location: Vietnam, Ninh Binh, Nghe An, Ha Tinh, Quang Tri, Thanh Hoa, Laos

title: Which economy is the most competitive in Asia?
summary: Vietnam's VnExpress newspaper covers diverse topics including business and sports. It highlights economic news, tourism, and national events.

title: The journey of Vietnamese tech companies going global
summary: Vietnamese tech companies have grown significantly, expanding globally and contributing to technological advancement. Pioneers like FPT and Viettel paved the way, overcoming challenges to build a strong international reputation. The sector continues to evolve, with new companies focusing on innovation and global markets.

title: Hanoi braces for National Day celebration with rain expected
summary: Hanoi anticipates National Day celebrations with mixed weather. Light rain is possible during events, but drier spells are expected for rehearsals.

title: 10 hours of widespread flooding in Hanoi after Typhoon Kajiki
summary: Typhoon Kajiki caused 10 hours of severe flooding in Hanoi, disrupting traffic, inundating homes and markets, and uprooting trees. Residents faced deep waters, with many vehicles stalled and businesses affected.

title: PM urges swift distribution of National Day cash gift
summary: Vietnam's PM orders swift distribution of VND100,000 gifts to citizens for the 80th National Day. The government allocated VND11 trillion for the initiative.

title: These Hanoi streets are off-limits for National Day
summary: Hanoi streets to close for National Day celebrations on Sept. 2. Preparations include parade and other events.

title: China’s BYD electric hypercar sets world record as fastest EV
summary: BYD's Yangwang U9 Track Edition achieved 293.5 mph, becoming the world's fastest EV. It surpasses other leading EVs with over 2,959 horsepower. The car utilizes a 1,200V platform and advanced body control systems.

title: Vietnam showcases modern tank fleet at national achievements exhibition
summary: Vietnam showcases modern tanks at an exhibition marking 80 years of National Day. The event highlights the strength and capabilities of the nation's armored forces.

title: HCMC interchange delay threatens expressway link to Long Thanh airport
summary: The An Phu interchange in Ho Chi Minh City faces delays, threatening the expressway link to Long Thanh airport. Construction progress is behind schedule, prompting city officials to urge acceleration.

title: Storm Nongfa lashes Vietnam’s central coast, villages cut off by floods
summary: Storm Nongfa hit Vietnam's north-central coast with high winds and heavy rain, causing floods and isolating villages. Authorities are coordinating evacuations and responses. This is the sixth storm this year.
location: Vietnam, Ha Tinh, Quang Tri, Nghe An, Thanh Hoa

title: Thousands in Hanoi brave overnight rain to camp for prime parade rehearsal spots
summary: Thousands in Hanoi braved rain and camped overnight for prime spots to watch a National Day parade rehearsal. Despite downpours, residents secured sidewalks to witness the event.
location: Hanoi, Hung Vuong Street, Nguyen Thai Hoc Street, Tran Phu Street

title: 72% of Singapore Gen Z lack retirement plans, but half believe they can retire well: Prudential
summary: Singaporean Gen Z is optimistic about retirement despite lacking plans. Baby Boomers regret starting financial planning late. High costs are a concern for all.

title: 'It's sickening': Mark Zuckerberg faces backlash after gifting headphones to neighbors around his 11 homes under construction
summary: Mark Zuckerberg angered Palo Alto neighbors with noise-canceling headphones due to construction. He spent over $110M on 11 homes, causing disruption and criticism.

title: 3 South Koreans rescued from Chinese-operated job scam in Vietnam
summary: Three South Koreans were rescued from a job scam in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. A Chinese national and accomplices illegally detained them and demanded payment for release. Authorities are investigating a wider trafficking ring.

title: Tropical depression near Vietnam's central coast likely to strengthen into storm today
summary: A tropical depression near Vietnam's coast is expected to become a storm, potentially making landfall between Nghe An and Hue. The recent Typhoon Kajiki caused significant damage and casualties in central Vietnam.
location: Vietnam, Hoang Sa, Nghe An, Hue, Ha Tinh, Laos

summary: Storm Nongfa weakened into a tropical depression, making landfall in central Vietnam. Heavy rainfall is expected in several provinces.

summary: Chinese troops arrived in Hanoi for Vietnam's National Day parade. Four foreign military delegations were invited by Vietnam. The parade will feature various military and civilian formations.

title: How to claim National Day $3.8 gift with your smartphone
summary: Vietnamese citizens can claim a $3.80 National Day gift via the VNeID app, linked with 19 banks. Citizens must log in, link their bank account, and navigate to "Social Security" to claim the gift.

summary: A forum in Hanoi on August 29 will focus on Vietnam's science, technology, innovation, and digital transformation. It aims to shape the future of these sectors for national development.
location: Vietnam Exposition Center, Dong Anh commune, Hanoi

summary: Typhoon Kajiki caused heavy rains and flooding in Hanoi, leading to long queues at motorbike repair shops. Mechanics worked to fix bikes stalled by water, with some repairs taking hours and increasing demand for spare parts.

title: Singapore durian seller accused of unhygienic packaging practices during livestreams
summary: A Singaporean durian seller faces criticism for poor hygiene during livestreams, with videos showing staff handling fruit improperly. The owner denies some claims and has filed a police report.

title: Trees uprooted, traffic stalled as heavy rains flood Hanoi streets in Typhoon Kajiki's wake
summary: Heavy rains from Typhoon Kajiki flooded Hanoi streets, causing traffic chaos and uprooting trees. Many commuters faced hours of delays, with some resorting to metros or wading through water.

summary: Malaysia offers discounted MyTourist Pass for unlimited travel on public transport and special promotions during National Month. Services extended for National Day.

title: inDrive app facilitating illegal ride-hailing made inaccessible in Singapore amid crackdown
summary: Singapore authorities have banned the inDrive app, used for illegal ride-hailing. The app is unavailable for download or use, following feedback and enforcement against unauthorized services.

title: Technical experts struggle as managers in multinationals
summary: Technical experts often struggle as managers in multinationals due to a lack of leadership skills. MBA programs, like BUV's, offer training to bridge this gap, enhancing strategic thinking and cross-cultural communication.

title: International passengers stranded for hours at Ho Chi Minh City airport due to system outage

summary: Large crowds gathered in Hanoi for the National Day parade rehearsal. Soldiers and tanks were in place, creating a lively atmosphere as citizens eagerly awaited the event. The rehearsal included formations and a veteran attending.

summary: Vietnam held a dress rehearsal for its 80th National Day parade in Hanoi. Thousands watched soldiers and military vehicles, including advanced defense systems and fighter jets, march.

summary: Americans own nearly half of foreign-owned apartments in Seoul, favoring upscale districts. Chinese nationals are the second-largest group. Investigations into improper property acquisitions and tax evasion are ongoing.

summary: An Air China plane from London to Beijing made an emergency landing in Siberia due to engine trouble. A replacement plane was sent for the 265 passengers and crew.

summary: Vietnam is the 4th fastest-growing tourist destination globally (38.64% increase). El Salvador also saw growth from improved safety. Global tourism is recovering.

summary: Vietnam achieved economic progress. ADB notes drivers & headwinds. Reforms and investment are key for future.

summary: The US dollar rose against the Vietnamese dong, reversing recent declines. Globally, the dollar retreated after a Trump announcement regarding a Fed Governor.

summary: Filipino Alexandra Eala made history at US Open, first from her country to win a Grand Slam singles match with a stunning comeback victory.
